title: Deltarune's closing credits confirm Chapter 5 should be with us comparatively soon
description: It's already been a lengthy journey for developer Toby Fox's Undertale follow-up Deltarune. The first of its seven planned chapters originally launched in 2018, and there are still three more to go - but we now know fans won't have too long to wait until the saga continues. According to the most recently released chapter's closing credits, part five will arrive next year. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Disco Elysium's "reimagined" mobile version is out soon and the first two chapters are free
description: If you've been considering taking Disco Elysium for another spin (or even a first spin) but want to do it on device small enough you could feasibly play it while, say, spelunking, there's some good news: the "reimagined" mobile version of developer ZA/UM Studio's acclaimed RPG comes to Android devices on 5th August. And if you still need some convincing it'll work on a smaller device, there's even more good news, as the first two chapters are free. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: The Girl Who Leapt Through Time 4K Steelbook Blu-Ray Annouced
description: The Girl Who Leapt Through Time 4K Steelbook Blu-ray $37 | Relase date TBA See at Amazon Wolf Children 4K Steelbook Blu-ray $37 | Releases on August 5 Preorder at Amazon Summer Wars 4K Steelbook Blu-ray (Amazon-exclusive) $30 See at Amazon Belle: 4K Steelbook Collector's Edition $45.49 See at Amazon Mamoru Hosoda has established himself as one of the best modern anime directors, having directed several critically acclaimed films over the past 20 years. Several of his movies have received new steelbook edition 4K Blu-ray releases in the past few months, and soon, his first movie, The Girl Who Leapt Through Time, will join the collection. While there's no release date set, listings are up at Amazon, and we expect it will be available soon. In the meantime, there are several other Hosoda films available for preorder and purchase now, including Wolf Children, Summer Wars, and Belle. We've compiled all the Hosoda 4K steelbook Blu-rays in the list below. The Girl Who Leapt Through Time 4K Steelbook Blu-ray $37 | Relase date TBA The Girl Who Leapt Through Time is Hosoda's first film and originally released back in 2001. It follows Makoto Konno, a teenager who attains time-travel powers. At first, she uses her abilities to fix frivolous problems, but she quickly learns that meddling with timelines can have drastic consequences. This limited edition 4K Blu-ray release includes an exclusive steelbook case.Bonus materials for the film haven't been confirmed yet, but previous Blu-ray releases for The Girl Who Leapt Through Time include tons of excellent extras, and there's a strong chance some of those are folded into this new 4K Steelbook Edition.While The Girl Who Leapt Through Time 4K Steelbook Blu-ray is listed at Amazon, it doesn't have a release date and is currently unavailable to purchase. We expect it'll be in stock again soon, however. In the meantime, there are several other Hosoda films up for preorder and available to purchase now. See at Amazon Wolf Children 4K Steelbook Blu-ray $37 | Releases on August 5 A 4K Steelbook of Hosoda's 2012 film Wolf Children releases on August 5 and is available to preorder for $37 at Amazon. The movie tells the story of Hana, a human woman who falls in love with a werewolf and eventually gives birth to two half-wolf children. After her husband tragically dies, Hana moves to an old house in the countryside to raise her children in this touching tale about motherhood, loss, and family. Special features include a commentary track from the cast and crew, promotional materials, and more. Preorder at Amazon Summer Wars 4K Steelbook Blu-ray (Amazon-exclusive) $30 Earlier this year, Hosuda's Summer Wars also received a 4K Steelbook Edition available exclusively at Amazon. Summer Wars follows Kenji, a young student obsessed with virtual reality. Kenji's friend Natsuki ropes him into a scheme where he poses as her girlfriend, but things go haywire when a rogue AI program steals his online identity and frames him for real-world catastrophes. With an imminent cyber-apocalypse on the horizon, Kenji and Natsuki's family unite to save the day and clear his name. The Amazon-exclusive Summer Wars 4K Steelbook Blu-ray includes the movie, a collectible steelbook case, and a selection of special features like interviews with the cast and Hosoda. See at Amazon Belle: 4K Steelbook Collector's Edition $45.49 Lastly, there's the 4K Steelbook Collector's Edition of Hosoda's newest film, Belle. This released back in 2022, and is available for $45.49 at Amazon. Belle follows Suzu, a high schooler who lives a double life. In reality, she's a shy teenager who lives in a rural village--but online, she's known as Belle, a wildly popular virtual-reality singer. When a mysterious beast crashes one of her online concerts, Suzu sets off on a journey to discover the truth behind the creature and her true self.This 4K Collector's Edition Blu-ray includes a 60-page art book, poster, sticker, and art cards, plus special features like behind-the-scenes production documentaries, music videos, and interviews. See at Amazon Belle: 4K Steelbook Collector's Edition More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders All Four Discontinued Donkey Kong Lego Sets Restocked At Amazon Donkey Kong Bananza Game & Amiibo Bundle Available At Walmart Amazon Carries Nintendo Games Again, Including New Switch 2 Exclusives + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5) Marvel's Spider-Man Magic: The Gathering Preorders Restocked At Amazon Amazon BOGO 50% Off Movie Sale Includes Brand-New 4K Steelbooks & Box Sets Amazon B1G1 50% Off Book Sale - Popular New Novels, Box Sets, And All-Time Greats 8BitDo's Best Controllers Get Switch 2 Support - How To Set Them Up And Why It's A Big Deal The 5,440-Page Complete History Of Middle Earth Box Set Is Only $106 At Amazon

title: Castlevania And Devil May Cry Anime Producer Buys Duke Nukem Rights
description: Through Netflix, producer Adi Shankar has already adapted Castlevania and Devil May Cry as anime series. Now, Shankar has revealed that he's picked up the rights for Duke Nukem, the first-person shooter franchise with a very dirty sense of humor created by developer 3D Realms."I bought the rights to Duke Nukem," said Shankar during an interview with Esquire. "Not the gaming rights, but I bought it from Gearbox... It's a middle finger to everybody. When Duke Nukem blew up, a bunch of people sat around trying to turn it into a brand, when it's just a middle finger. Duke Nukem can't be made by a corporation, because the moment a corporation makes Duke Nukem, it's no longer Duke Nukem. I don't intend on having anyone tell me what to do on this one."It's unclear how or if Shankar's deal with Gearbox affects the live-action Duke Nukem movie in development at Legendary with the creators of Cobra Kai. That project hasn't had many updates since it was announced in 2022. Similarly, the most recent game in the franchise, Duke Nukem Forever, was released in 2011, and there haven't been any new Duke Nukem games, or talk of making any sequels, since.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 883
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Do you care about Labubus? Nah, I just don’t get the hype. 2. What’s your favorite summer dessert? Hmm, all of them? If pressed to pick one, then ice cream. 3. Do you have plans for the Fourth of July yet? Connor will be dancing with her dance team in the town parade, so that’s our main event during the day. We’ll probably do a barbeque at home after the parade. Where we live doesn’t allow fireworks, so we may or may not go looking for a fireworks display. We’ll see how ambitious we’re feeling! 4. How do you feel about maxi dresses? If it’s in a petite size and the print isn’t too overwhelming, then I’ll rock a maxi dress, for sure. 5. What is the[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 883 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 864
description: Heya, friend! Happy late Father’s Day to ya! Hope you had a great one. Except for a brief drive out to visit the fam in the East Bay, we stayed around the house. But it was fun. Lots of high-intensity lounging, TV watching and chillaxin’… Rosie, purr usual, spent the day working on her science experiments. That reminds me… Tabs wasn’t particularly interested in science or genetics like Rosie is, but he was interested in acting as a father figure to at-risk kittens and a mentor to up-and-coming kitty supermodels. Despite his busy schedule, he always made time for the kittens in his foundation. He would read to them, do homework with them, teach them how to strut and strike poses on the catwalk — all the basic life skills. Rosie Rosie’s view of Father’s Day is a little different. As an introverted, more science-minded cat, she’s more interested in the genetic aspects of parentage. She was recently tapped by Genentech to lead a study into inherited traits that get passed along from father cat[Continue reading...] The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 864 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Have fun failing to reload your gun fast enough in this cornfield creepfest
description: Indie horror game developer Ruled are onto a nice little spree with their shortform Itch.io releases - seemingly, they are skipping from phobia to phobia. First there was Automatonophobia, a game that navigated the fear of subterranean golems, then there was Chrometophobia, a game dedicated to the fear of spending money, and also to the act of finding "grimbo" gibs for a delicious pie. What's next on the menu? Ah yes, scarecrows. Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: Skyblivion devs used their Bethesda visit to fight the good fight, asking Todd and co to bring back Skyrim-style official modding tutorials
description: While the prospect The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered turning out to be a real thing had folks wondering what that might mean for Oblivion remake mod Skyblivion's release, Bethesda were quick quell fears of a shutdown. Both sides have been openly chummy since that point, with the studio behind The Elder Scrolls even having the team of modders pop by for a visit around the time their project was being shouted out on the official channels. We've now learned a bit more about how that social call went and what the two sides chatted about. Read more
author: Mark Warren
